organization.fullName: Institut d'Investigació Biomèdica de Girona Dr. Josep Trueta

identificationModule.briefTitle: Multicentre ObseRvational Study in Posterior mecHanical thrombEctomy: conscioUs Sedation vs General aneSthesia
identificationModule.officialTitle: Multicentre ObseRvational Study in Posterior mecHanical thrombEctomy: conscioUs Sedation vs General aneSthesia: MORPHEUS STROKE REGISTRY

leadSponsor.name: Institut d'Investigació Biomèdica de Girona Dr. Josep Trueta

descriptionModule.briefSummary:
The association of conscious sedation vs. general anesthesia in ischemic stroke with posterior circulation occlusions undergoing endovascular therapy, is istill unknown.

No prospective or clinical trials have studied this effect on posterior circulation strokes.

The choice of anesthetic regimen is ussually depending on local stroke-team protocols or neurointerventional preference.

MORPHEUS Stroke Registry is a prospective multicentre observational study that investigates the association between anestheisa and functional outcome in patients with posterior circulation large vessel occlusion treated endovascularly.

interventions.name: Type of anesthesia choice
interventions.description: Use of conscious sedation vs. general anesthesia

primaryOutcomes.description: Rate of functional independence (modified Rankin Scale 0-2) at 3 months

secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of complete successful recanalization (mTICI 2c-3) with one single pass of device

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Successfull recanalization and complete recanalization according to endovascular technique
secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of mTICI 3 and mTICI 2b-3 according to endovascular technique (contact aspiration, stentriever or combined)
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day, revascularization grade will be assessed

secondaryOutcomes.description: Number of intracranial thrombectomy passes to achieve final reperfusion
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day, number of device passes will be assessed

secondaryOutcomes.description: Rate of neurological status at 24 hours, dramatical neurological improvement after mechanical thrombectomy
Study of the type of anesthesic choice and complications, time of intubation and
Rates of FPE and succesful recanalization according to the length of stentretriever used
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day, stentretriever type will be assessed

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Arterial hypotension during anesthesic induction and outcome
secondaryOutcomes.description: Study of arterial hypotension during anesthesic induction and outcome
To study the association between bridging therapy and reperfussion rates, neurological status and funtional independence at 3 months.
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: 1 day, type of previous fibrinolytic use will be assessed

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subject aged ≥ 18 years
* Evidence of posterior arterial occlussion (basilar artery, intracranial vertebral artery and posterior cerebral artery)
* Patients eligible for mechanical thrombectomy

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient's refusal to participate
* Arterial recanalization prior to endovascular thrombectomy attempt
* Patient unable to present or be available for follow-up
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: Patients eligible for mechanical thrombectomy due to ischemic stroke and presence of arterial occlusion in intracranial posterior circulation

locations.facility: Hospital Universitari Doctor Josep Trueta de Girona
